H0.text: Which controversial mogul/celebrity/politician demanded a ban on all Muslims entering the USA in 2015. Donald Trump

H1.text: Which controversial mogul/celebrity/politician demanded a ban on all Muslims entering the USA in 2015. Ted Cruz

H2.text: Which controversial mogul/celebrity/politician demanded a ban on all Muslims entering the USA in 2015. Ben Carson

H3.text: Which controversial mogul/celebrity/politician demanded a ban on all Muslims entering the USA in 2015. Trumpian

A4.text: In January 2017, Trump signed an executive order that denied entry to citizens from six Muslim-majority countries for four months and from Syria indefinitely.

A5.text: Trump called for a temporary ban on any Muslims entering the country.

A6.text: The Pentagon issued a statement of concern, stating Trump's remarks could strengthen the resolve of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL).

A7.text: Donald J. Trump is calling for a total and complete shutdown of Muslims entering the United States until our country's representatives can figure out what is going on

A8.text: In November 2017, Trump shared anti‑Muslim posts from the far‑right group Britain First via Twitter.

A9.text: The travel ban enacted by the Trump administration that limited refugees from entering the United States from several counties with significant or majority Muslim populations was seen as being rooted in Islamophobia by several researchers.
